newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HKCB Bank up on hope of China Res link.
newsitem.headline: HKCB Bank up on hope of China Res link.

text.p: Shares of HKCB Bank Holding Co Ltd rose on Thursday on market talk that China Resources (Holdings) Co Ltd may increase its stake in the company, brokers said.
HKCB Bank shares were up HK$0.6, or 16.33 percent, to HK$4.275 at midday after hitting an all-time high of HK$4.55. Volume was 65.37 million shares worth HK$272.77 million.

"Talk that China Resources might up its stake in the company led to anticipation of stronger growth potential through the strengthening of ties with the Chinese firm, and that fuelled buying," said a sales manager at a regional brokerage.
China Resources (Holdings) -- the trading arm of China's Ministry of Foreign Trade and the parent of China Resources Enterprise Ltd -- held 1.1 percent of HKCB Bank as of June 1996.
China Resources (Holdings) also holds a 50 percent stake in HKCB Bank's 50 percent owned commercial banking concern The Hongkong Chinese Bank Ltd.
HKCB Bank said on Thursday morning it was not aware of any reasons for the recent rise in its share price and turnover.
